lines:
me limon

December Fifth 
Io 18

Mr. Guy Lowell

12 West Street

Boston, Mass.

ay dear Mr. Lowell:

I wonder if you have any opening in your office for a 
young Chinese boy, a recent graduate of the Massachusetts Institute of

Technology, who has been making a specialty of the study of architect -
uro, and who is very eager to secure some practical ayno rience in a good 
American office before returning to China. Suns sing twan, the boy in

question, is one of our old Andover students, and one of the finest of the

many storling Chinese boya chat wo have had homo in pocent years,

That is

saying a god bio, for we have had some exceptionally able and promising

fellows in the low.

I think perhaps I knor Kuan na ng intimately than the

others; for besides the nomaint mao which I had with him during his school 
days, I met him to China when I was there soveral years ago, and hava kept 
in touch with him since his return to this country. He is not only abla 
and carness, but as clean and fino a type of manhood as one of ton maats.

Just at prosent Kwan is taking ovening courses at Bos--

ton University in Business Administration and wrici oncy. He is willing, 
if not eager, to start at the very bottom and take any position that offers 
him a chance to get some real practical experience under good influences. 
The financial side of the proposition does not interest him particularly at 
prosent. I feel confident therefore that if you have any kind of an open -
ing, you would find it well worth your while to try this fellow out. Un -
1098 I am very much mis taken, my oën high-opinion of him and his ability

will be fully endorsed by his instructors at Technology who are more famil -
